intro: Carallia integerrima, commonly known as the red sandalwood or red cedar, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
